text:
That's alright no worries. Wow that sounds pretty cool!

My project is coming along alright, I'm trying to track an arm with tracking markers in 3Dequalizer and then replace that arm with a CG arm (robotic or whatever). I've done a few tracking tests and it turned out quite tricky to track an arm properly.
I've also just this week discovered a plugin for nuke called geotracker which kind of allows you to track 3D objects in nuke. So I've been playing around with that a bit as well. Have you heard of this plugin or even used it maybe?
Ah sounds great. I've used the plugin quite a lot actually, it's really great
I first used it after trying to object track some things in pftrack and I'm not too familiar with 3D software so wondered what I could do in Nuke and tried that out and it worked amazingly

Oh nice, I might have some questions regarding that plugin when I'm back at uni on monday if that's alright? This would be so much easier if I can make it work in nuke rather than object tracking it in 3Dequalizer
Also, as part of an assignment for my uni I have to 'interview' someone from the industry, would you mind if I send you 8 short questions over this weekend?
